grading_system.description: System type not specified on official website. Results posted at facilities and available at Environmental Health Department but grading methodology not detailed.

inspection_details.public_disclosure: Results viewable at individual facilities and obtainable at Environmental Health Department

fire_safety_authority.department_name: Multiple agencies - Amador Fire Protection District, City of Jackson Fire Department, other local fire protection districts
fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Per California fire code - 6-month inspections by licensed fire protection company required

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CalCode) - California Health and Safety Code
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County-level inspections - state mandated program administered locally
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Not specified beyond state CalCode compliance

confidence_notes: While basic program structure is confirmed, specific grading methodology (letter grades vs. numerical scores vs. pass/fail) is not detailed on official county website. Fire safety information limited to general California requirements.
verification_notes: Direct contact with Amador County Environmental Health Department (209) 223-6439 required to verify: 1) Specific grading/scoring system used 2) Risk-based inspection categories 3) Reinspection triggers and thresholds 4) Local ordinances beyond state requirements 5) Specific fire authority jurisdiction for commercial kitchens
